title: Experimental Process for Polymer Nanomicelle Fabrication and Characterization Research

context.prior_knowledge: Introduction to basic polymer chemistry, nanomaterials, and fundamental experimental design principles
context.additional_context: Applied research-linked program for corporate managers/leaders, emphasizing practical skill enhancement through real-life problem-solving in mobile-device-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can independently perform experiments from design to analysis of nanomicelle manufacturing processes using block copolymers.
Learners can quantitatively evaluate the particle size, morphology, and stability of micelles using nano-characterization equipment such as DLS and TEM.
Learners can propose innovative ideas for nanoscale material applications (e.g., drug delivery, environmental remediation) based on experimental results.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
